Quiz result
A cat\'s whiskers help it hunt at night.
When resting, a cat\'s heart beats nearly twice as fast as a human\'s.
A cat can see in complete darkness.
A cat can jump up to 5 times its own height.
Cats can drink saltwater.
There are 500 breeds of cats.
Cats only sweat through their paws.
On 18 October 1963, Félicette was the first cat to travel into space.
There are more dogs as pets in the world than cats.
Over 5000 years ago, the Egyptians considered cats to be evil.
Like dogs, cats can become ill or even die because of eating chocolate.
In the 15th century, due to superstitions, cats were forbidden from boarding ships.
The Egyptian Mau is probably the oldest breed of cat.
Cats rarely meow to communicate amongst themselves.
Cats see a broad spectrum of colors.
Cats have blurred distance vision and poor near vision.
Cats dream.
Deep purring can be a sign of well-being but also a sign of pain.
The smallest breed of cat is the Singapura.
Cats have a refined palate.
The pads on a cat\'s paw don\'t feel anything.
A cat rubs its head on people to "mark" its smell.
Cats are more domesticated than dogs.
Turkish Van cats like water.
Cats can hear three times better than humans.
A cat can run at a speed of 31 mph (49 km/h).
Cats have fewer bones than humans.
Cats cannot see the area below their nose.
A cat\'s sense of smell is not as good as a human\'s.
Cats have 32 muscles in each ear. Humans only have 6.
Cats can\'t taste sugar.
Cats prefer hot food.
In total, a cat spends 4 years of its life awake.
Cats do not have collarbones.
A cat\'s whiskers detects movements of air. This allows them to detect anything moving in the dark.
When resting, a cat\'s heart beats at 110 to 140 beats per minute.
Even though cats can see in the dark, they cannot see in complete darkness. They need a small source of light in order to see.
In one leap, a cat can jump up to 5 times its own height.
A cat\'s kidneys can filter sea salt. This allows them to rehydrate by drinking seawater.

There are around 80 breeds of cats. This number is poorly defined because cat breeds are not uniformly named or recognized, or their standards are sometimes different according to cat association in every country.
Cats only have sweat glands between the pads of their paws.
Félicette was the first cat to travel into space. She was also the only cat to survive a space mission.
In the world, there are around 600 million domestic cats and around 500 million domestic dogs.
The Egyptians did not consider cats evil: on the contrary, they worshiped cats. When domestic cats died, they were often embalmed.
Theobromine, a substance present in chocolate, is toxic to dogs and cats.
In the 15th century, almost all ships had cats. Their role was to exterminate any rats on board.
The Egyptian Mau is probably the oldest breed of cat. In fact, "mau" means cat in Egyptian.
With a few exceptions, cats only meow for communicating with humans. When cats communicate with other cats they use grunts, growls, howls, whistles, cries, etc.
Cats see a very limited range of colors. They see yellow and blue but not red.
Cats have blurred distance vision and poor near vision. Their vision is best between 4 and 32 in. (10 and 80 cm).
Cats dream from when they are a week old. When sleeping, cats have similar brain waves to those of humans.
Purring is often a sign of well-being, but a cat may also purr when it is stressed or when it is in pain.
The smallest breed of cat is Singapura, which weighs only around 4 lb. (1.8 kg).
A cat\'s sense of taste is less developed than that of a human. Cats have fewer than 500 taste buds while humans have over 9000.
The pads are covered in highly sensitive touch receptors that allow the cat to evaluate the texture, temperature and resistance of a surface, object, or prey.
Cats have scent glands around their lips, under their chin, and between their eyes and ears. Therefore, they mark their smell on objects and people with their heads.
Present day cats are a lot closer to their wild ancestors than dogs are. They are therefore less domesticated than dogs.
Unlike most cats, Turkish Van cats like water and will go swimming to cool off.
The range of sound vibrations detected by cats is around 3 times wider than that detected by humans.
A cat can run at 31 mph (49 km/h), but only over a short distance.

Cats have at least 24 more bones than humans. While humans have 206 bones, cats have at least 230. This number varies because the number of vertebrae in the tail changes from one breed of cat to another.
Thanks to hundreds of millions of olfactory sensors that line its nasal cavity, a cat\'s sense of smell is 100 times more sensitive to smell than a human\'s.
With their 32 muscles in each ear, cats can rotate their ears independently and so they are able to detect sounds better.
Cats do not have the necessary receptors to taste sugars. You can\'t coax them with sweet things!
Cats prefer their food to be at room temperature, not too cold and not too hot.
On average, a cat sleeps for 2/3 of a day. At the end of its life, an average cat will have slept 8 years and been awake for 4.
Cats do not have collarbones, which allows them to squeeze into small spaces. If a cat can get its head through an opening, then the rest of its body will also be able to squeeze through.
